sentences: Temast sai leitnant pärast lühikest kursust.
Leitnant juhtis oma üksust edukalt lahingus.
context: In Estonian, 'leitnant' is a military rank equivalent to lieutenant or second lieutenant in English-speaking countries. It's used in the Estonian Defense Forces and other armed services to denote an officer who typically commands a platoon or serves as a deputy commander of a company.
